response: *Rupert Wegerif - Professor of Education at the University of Cambridge Fellow of Hughes Hall

Dialogic education has been defined as engaging students in an ongoing process of shared enquiry taking the form of a dialogueWells, G. (1999). Dialogic inquiry: Towards a sociocultural practice and theory of education.Cambridge: Cambridge University Press. and as Robin Alexander outlines in his work on dialogic teaching, it involves drawing students into a process of co-constructing knowledge. Rupert Wegerif sums this up by claiming that 'Dialogic Education is education for dialogue as well as education through dialogue'.Wegerif, R. (2013). Dialogic: Education for the internet age. Routledge
